name: Sorido Bay Resort

reviews.title: Spectacular luxury in Paradise!
reviews.text: Stayed for 2 weeks and had the best diving we had ever experienced. The staff are real Papuan natives and extremely friendly and accommodating. There is a South African couple in charge, and they make everything seem effortless. One has to understand that this is FAR off the beaten path and supplies etc. are not easy to get. The owner has carved out a piece of heaven from the jungle in the most beautiful spot on earth. The food was excellent, the dive-staff could not speak English, but they were 'superman' below the surface. We had a sensory overload on every dive. We had never seen so many fish; not to mention the amount of mantas at manta point. The only 'annoying' thing was the many live-aboards that 'camped' on our doorstep, because the best dive-sites in the Raja Ampat are literary minutes away from our doorstep.

reviews.title: heaven on earth
reviews.text: The bungalows are massive and right on the beach. Only 6 of them, which means only 12 guests total! The dive-boats are fast and with plenty of room for cameras etc. They also have canvas tops, so the sun is not a factor any more while I'm waiting for the other divers to finish their 75 minute dive!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have had the privilege of diving in many parts of the world and this was one of the top (if not the top). The resort was wonderful. The huts are right on the ocean, king size bed, huge shower, a/c and even a t.v. (if you dared to watch). The staff is very friendly and the dive masters know all about the landscape underwater. They all worked incredibly hard to make sure we had a good week. The food was plentiful and Max (the owner) shared most meals with us. Max is really making a difference in many people’s lives. The reefs are pristine and because not many people are willing to make the long journey hopefully they will stay that way. The boat ride from Sorong was a bit of a challenge do to rough seas but an easy ride back. Would highly recommend this location !
reviews.title: A Homerun !!

reviews.text: Sorido bay resort advertises with 'the best diving site' in the world. And indeed, it is really fantastic, small scale diving tourism, maximum 10-20 people in Sorido and about the same in the sister resort Kri Eco. Maximum 6 people in a boat with 2 dive guides and 2 supporting people on the boat. It is really luxury. The resort on the small island Kri is very well setup, excellent service, nice bungalows, clean, breakfast/lunch/dinner together with other guests, very good to get to know each other and to chat. I really liked the fact Max Ammer works together with local people. The staff is mainly Papuan, the dive guides as well. And the diving is really fantastic, you can see a lot, a lot of fish, coral, 'small stuff', a large diversity in sea life. It is difficult to say, that this is the best dive site in the world. I do not like these superlatives. But surely, Raja Ampat is extraordinary. There are only few points of 'criticism'. The food is a bit lopsided, even if you accept the difficult logistics. It is chicken or fish (sometimes beef), very small diversity in vegetables, no special food for vegetarians and no shellfish. There was a 'funny' anecdote, a cuttlefish jumped coincidentely into our boat. And the Papuan on the boat was really happy to cook this cuttlefish in the evening, because he would not get this kind of food from the resort kitchen, which follows the 7 days adventist rules (no shellfish, cuttlefish, et cetera).
reviews.title: Fantastic diving, nice resort, excellent service

reviews.text: But the desserts, fruits were very excellent.
reviews.title: Ecotourism at its best - amazing reefs, amazing views, amazing people.

reviews.text: A second point of attention: I missed a bit expertise about marine life from the dive guides. Not only finding something, but also explain, chat, debriefing after a dive, about interaction between organisms.
reviews.title: we met the documentary team for National Geographic TV

reviews.text: Max Ammer is a genius. The man behind this gem of a place, he pioneered ecotourism in Kri (Raja Ampat). I have been diving on coral reefs for 11 years and the Sorido Bay "house reefs" are among the best in the world. From pygmy seahorses to manta rays to 100% coral cover, you will be thrilled with the underwater scenery. Above water is just as pretty - Max has created ocean-view accommodations dotted with authentic Papuan artwork, and ever convenience (eco-friendly, of course!). The food is incredible, the dive guides are phenomenal, and the diving is world-class. Max is a delight, and his resort epitomizes simple elegance. The boat ride from Sorong is the only downside - cramped and long, it is not the most pleasant experience. However, 1 bad boat ride is COMPLETELY worth the fabulous experience at Kri - I have never written a report this glowing before, but this place deserves every accolade. Whether relaxing onshore or diving underwater, I give this eco-resort my highest recommendation. Bravo!
reviews.title: I've never been there and for a reason

reviews.text: Well, I have owed Sorido bay this review for quite some time now Last year with new flight from Manado and also I guess due to some positive changes in resort management I could fit Sorido bay into my travel plans and actually visit it having to spend only one night in Sorong on the way from Manado.
reviews.title: a long owed review - wonderful resort with nice diving

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PROS: The trip was full of surprises, I expected to see a less than average resort with 5 star diving as the ony excuse to stay there. But I absoutely fell in love with the resort itself - beautiful settings, tranquility, nice and spacious rooms. Food was basic but really good, nothing to complain about and much better than what you usually get at Lembeh resorts. New managers - Johny and Julia are amazing, they seem to be perfect fit for the resort and I only hope Max can keep them there for a long time, if they stay there, then hopefully customer service prolems experienced by me and some others will become a non-issue. Johny and Julie seem to understand how to build relationshp with the guests quite well, at least on my trip they couldn't be more helpful and caring.
reviews.title: best diving ever

reviews.text: Max, the owner, was indeed present at the table for every meal but at least during our stay I've never heard him talking about God, singing religious anthems or doing anything that could make me, an atheist, feel uncomfortable.
reviews.title: Cancellation policy - misleading

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: CONS: The internet access was there only part time, often it wasn't availale but I guess they were planning to change ISP. Well, for a remote island that's understandable.
reviews.title: paradise - with strings attached

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Surprisingly diving was somewhat disappointing. While generally it was great, I expected more. Probably marketing hype about Raja Ampat increased my expectations too much. Very good for mid-size fish and hard coral but very poor macro comparing to just anywhere else I dived in Indonesia and less than average for soft coral (Bangka wins in terms of soft coral easily). For larger fish - reef sharks on every dive, napoleons, wobbegong sharks and that's about it. Manta dive was amazing, 5 mantas staing really close (one could touch them) for the whole dive.
reviews.title: great accommodation and location, shame about the rest

description: Upscale Dive resort based on the private island of Kri. Located in the centre of Northern Raja Ampat with the famous Cape Kri as a house reef.Top quality diving and bird watching.
